english: to transport; to move; to run/operate; luck/fortune

etymology.interpretation: The walking/motion component signals meanings related to movement, transport, or circulation. 軍 supplies the sound value and also evokes organized movement, which fits senses like transporting or operating. Over time this phonetic link helped extend usage to ideas like running/operating and luck/fortune in compounds.
etymology.simplification: Traditional 運 was simplified to 运 by replacing the phonetic 軍 with the simpler 云 while retaining the 辶 ‘walk’ element, reducing stroke count and keeping a similar phonetic cue.

examples.chinese: 我们明天运货到上海(我們明天運貨到上海)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen míngtiān yùn huò dào Shànghǎi.
examples.english: We will ship goods to Shanghai tomorrow.

examples.chinese: 这台机器运转平稳(這台機器運轉平穩)。
他最近运气很好(他最近運氣很好)。
examples.english: He has had very good luck lately.
